Text.Text: ZZZzzzZZZzzz.
Please forgive me for ignoring you earlier.  I'd no idea building this entire temple within a day would drain so much energy from me...  Well met - I'm Nickademus.
We meet again - in my bedroom no less.  I hope your experiences have been sufficient.
Whoa - slow down, death-dealer!  I'm not your enemy.
Yes... *and* yes.
I see reasoning with you is like pleading with an angry dragon.  If pain is what you seek, then I SHALL DELIVER!

Not necessarily... I've worked *for* them, not *with* them.  To be honest, I disagree with their resolve, but - ha - *you* try convincing three women who share the same mind that what they're doing will lead to certain ruin.

I was handsomely paid by the high priestesses to build this temple in haste, but would've done it for free had Oria alone asked it of me.  I do still love her, but fate has blackened her heart... I place no blame upon you for what has or will be done.

I used techniques taught to me by my mentor Halaster to incorporate enough curiosities so as to keep the sisters from trouble, as well as let Oria develop her skills and intellect.  Sadly, their obsession with Kuldahar is so strong it defies comprehension - Auril's will *must* be to blame.
Yes, I will - but only once - for there's much work I've yet to do.  All I ask in return is one, small, future favor.

There's something I've been working on - something that hopefully will prevent innocents like Oria from so easily being seduced by darkness.  When my hand is played, I *may* need to call on you for assistance.
Not yet, but soon.
How may I help you?
Yes, in fact a number of postulants have made that very mistake - perhaps more from curiosity than anything else... there - the prism should be fine now.  Farewell.

It launches bolts of lightning that reflect off of any mirror they strike until spent.  It's driven by two control panels, one to rotate it in one of eight directions and the other to fire at its current facing.

Besides the obvious tactical application, this level contains two traps and four doors that can only be disabled or opened by one of these bolts.  The prism was a special request from the *lovely* Sherincal - not sure if you've met her yet.
It can be rotated left and right in one of eight directions, with its north position facing the center of the abishai lair behind the set of three doors in that room.

To unlock Oria's study, turn it left to the southwest then right to the northwest; to open the doors to the abishai den, turn it left north then right north; to disable the prison's antimagic effects, turn the dais right east then left west.  Good luck, and farewell.

Ahh, the Game Room - or "Arena" as Cathin refers to it - is still under construction, but can be controlled by its thirteen switches.  From its southwest corner there's one to activate or deactivate the selected mode, two to set one of three modes, and the remaining ten are for ranking - or difficulty.

The first mode I intended to use for temple maintenance - though never progressing past prism repair.  The third is a contest of might I call Battle Square.  To play, set the rank, obtain three consecutive squares to win, win with three to seven squares to achieve rank levels one to five, achieve all levels of a rank to complete it, and complete all ranks for mastery.

*However,* the second mode, my crowning achievement, portals one to and from a slice of the ethereal realm I've molded within this level.  This I made for Oria for times when she craves solitude, even from her kin.
Yes - I see you have some of its components - it'll soften my task if I can get them from you.
Excellent - I'll return momentarily.  Please make yourselves comfortable while I'm gone.
Of course it is.  My apprentices are away on errands for me and- hmmm, perhaps it's time my hands were reacquainted with humble labor.
It'll take me a few moments to gather the needed reagents, but I'll return with haste.  Please make yourselves comfortable while I'm gone.
The task is complete.  A true marvel that ship was - give my regards to her captain when you see him again.  Farewell.

Yes... <CHARNAME>... I see your thoughts... I see a ship-an airship... I'm going inside - I see your friend - a gnome - his name is... Oswald... Oswald, I'm Nickademus - a friend... see my thoughts - let me h-arrggg!
I was reaching out to your companion when I felt a titan's weight crashing down upon my skull.  Be they Auril's offenses or Oswald's defenses - this task I cannot complete from afar.
However, in my brief perusal of his brilliant mind I've learned he responds well to the sound of his name.  Go to him, declare it loudly, and he shall eventually awaken.  Farewell.

He's the spirit of a tempest - also known as Caged Fury - bound into Auril's altar by Talos, lord of all forces of destruction and Auril's superior.  I can't get involved directly, for reasons I'm not at liberty to discuss, but I *can* assist you.
Don't deal directly with him - he only wants to drain the moisture from your blood.  Instead, invoke his true name before him and I'll provide spells to help protect you from his wrath unfurled.
Certainly - here you are.  I hope they'll prove useful. Farewell.
Certainly, th-hmmm, curious... I was sure I had a few items on that shelf - some of them seem to have disappeared.  I'm afraid you'll have to ask for something else.
Excellent - I'll have my apprentices collect the remaining components, then return when the spell is cast.  Please make yourselves comfortable in my absence.
What would you like to know?

A curiosity - its canvas was actually bare when I procured it from the bowels of Undermountain.  When it hears you speak a phrase it's been taught, it'll activate a teleporter embedded within the stairs below it that'll whisk you to a particular location.

For instance, if I stand before it, say "Bedroom," then take the stairs, I'll end up here.  Other phrases taught to it by the high priestesses, Sherincal, and others will lead to the Game Room, the altar cleansing room, a private treasure vault, the abishai den, and other places I'm unfamiliar with.

It sounds like she tried killing you with the Retributive Strike from her Staff of Power, but she ended up in the ethereal realm instead.  The Inner Sanctum is complete, and you can use it to reach her - unfortunately, she traveled to that realm directly, and is thus lost forever.

Go to the Game Room to the southeast, turn on switch "Mode Selector 1," turn off switch 'Mode Selector 2,' then turn on the one labeled "Mode Activator."  You'll be able to defeat her while in the Inner Sanctum, but make sure you turn it off when you're done, else be trapped in there forever.
Friends, forgive my intrusion, but I must call in that favor.  Please slay the fiends I've trapped in this level, and the stairway leading to the painting will return you to the Fields of Slaughter.

Friends, your help was invaluable and the favor is fully paid.  I've many more fiends to pull from the Abyss once I've rested, so I've little time to talk.  The stairway leading to the painting will take you to the Fields of Slaughter.  You'll not be able to return, so leave nothing behind.
Though *quite* expensive, that Mirror of Life Trapping is a rather effective ward.  Those inside are the group Talisman, ensnared while retrieving the equipment of a prisoner named Nathaniel.

Though *quite* expensive, that Mirror of Life Trapping was a rather effective ward.  Those inside were the group Talisman, ensnared while retrieving the equipment of a prisoner named Nathaniel.  When you broke it, their warped minds mistakenly blamed you for their imprisonment.

Unfortunately, I was never given the command word - aha, which would explain its reduced price - so I cannot safely extract them.  They'll emerge from the mirror if you break it, but their warped minds will mistakenly, violently blame you for their imprisonment.

Well, I couldn't describe them all to you - perhaps if you encounter something within the temple that strikes you as curious, you could ask.  Otherwise, you would be in for a *very* long speech, indeed - one your ears may not survive.

But, as an example, if you walk up the eastern stairs of this level, you will find a painting... of a great tree, a splash of color within these mirrored halls.  It's quite amazing, really... examine it closely and see if you can figure out its purpose.   If you can't discern its abilities... well, simply return here, and I will be pleased to enlighten you.
When we fought High Priestess Oria, she broke her staff and now exists within an ethereal realm called "Inner Sanctum" that you created.  How can we defeat her?
Lysara mentioned you.  Why'd you build this temple for her?
You built this temple?  In a day?
You built this temple?  Then you'll die for the trouble you and your Aurilites have caused!
Yes, we know all about you - "arch-architect - honored guest - former lover of Oria."   You'll die for the trouble you and your Aurilites have caused!
Well met.  Farewell.
When we fought High Priestess Oria, she broke her staff and now exists within an ethereal realm called "Inner Sanctum" that you created.  How can we defeat her?
Will you help us?
Tell me about that favor again.
We know what we'd like to ask of you now.
Are you ready to collect on that favor?
Tell me something.
May we rest here for a few hours?
May we rest here until our wounds have healed?
Sufficient enough.  Farewell.
Didn't you build this temple for the Aurilities, and aren't they blocking the Western Pass in exchange for the destruction of Kuldahar?
We'll spare your life for now.  Farewell.
Doesn't that make you our enemy?
And that's why you're about to die!
Will you help us?
Your story won't save your life!
I see - however, we'll spare your life for now.  Farewell.
Will you help us?
Tell me something.
I see.  Farewell.
All right.
What kind of favor?
Never mind.  Farewell.
All right.
We'll consider it.  Farewell.
We accidentally disabled the prism.  Can you fix it?
Can you help us defeat an entity known as Aeij-Kllenzr't?
As a wizard you must have seen many wonders in this world.  Can you share some of your wisdom with us?
As a wizard you must have collected many items in your travels.  Care to part with any of them?
As a wizard you must have collected many items in your travels.  Care to part with any of them?
We've changed our minds.  Farewell.
Let us think about it.  Farewell.
Farewell.
Tell me something else.
Yes we have.  Farewell.
Not yet, but I'm sure we will.  Farewell.
Tell me something else.
Farewell.
Tell me something else.
Farewell.
Yes, here you are.
Yes, here you are.
Actually, we'd like to keep them if that's all right with you.
On second thought, can we ask for something else?
We will.  Farewell.
What happened?
Farewell.
Go on.
We'll take whatever help you can give us.
We'll need to prepare.  Farewell for now.
On second thought, can we ask for something else?
Farewell.
All right.
Actually we've changed our minds.  Farewell.
Let us think about it.  Farewell.
We'd like to know more about that prism device.
You mentioned curiosities you placed in this temple before... what did you mean by that?
There's a dais in Lysara's sacrificial chamber on the first floor.  Tell us how it works.
What can you tell us about the room southeast of here with a checkered central floor and several switches along the walls?
Will you help us?
What's the story behind the oil painting upstairs depicting a frozen Kuldahar with its snow-covered Great Tree withering?
Tell me about that favor again.
Can you tell us anything about the large mirror in a room southwest of here?  It seems there are a number of people trapped inside.
We know what we'd like to ask of you now.

Can you tell us anything about the large mirror in a room southwest of here?  There were a number of people trapped inside who attacked us for no reason when we broke it, even though they were freed in the process.
Are you ready to collect on that favor?
May we rest here for a few hours?
May we rest here until our wounds have healed?
Let us think about it.  Farewell.
Tell me something else.
Farewell.
Tell me something first.
Tell me something first.
Farewell.
Farewell.
Farewell.
Can they be freed?
Tell me something else.
Farewell.
Tell me something else.
Farewell.
Actually, we already found it.  What does it do?
Tell me something else.
Farewell.

Actions:
SetGlobal("41NickHelp", "GLOBAL", 3)
FadeToColor([0.0],0)
TriggerActivation("PrismRotate",TRUE)
TriggerActivation("PrismFire",TRUE)
SetGlobal("PrismDeactivated","MYAREA",0)
Wait(3)
DisplayString(Myself,30531)
CloseDoor("AR4102_Switch1")
CloseDoor("AR4102_Switch2")
OpenDoor("AR4102_Switch3")
FadeFromColor([0.0],0)

TakePartyItem("40BookOS")
TakePartyItem("00Potn50")
TakePartyItem("40GenBe")
TakePartyItem("40GenSS")
TakePartyItemAll("40GenWP")
TakePartyItemNum("00Gem26",2)
TakePartyItem("30IStone")
TakePartyItem("00Misc18")

TakePartyItem("40BookOS")
TakePartyItem("00Potn50")
TakePartyItem("40GenBe")
TakePartyItem("40GenSS")
TakePartyItemAll("40GenWP")
TakePartyItemNum("00Gem26",2)
TakePartyItem("30IStone")
TakePartyItem("00Misc18")

DestroyItem("40BookOS")
DestroyItem("00Potn50")
DestroyItem("40GenBe")
DestroyItem("40GenSS")
DestroyItem("40GenWP")
DestroyItem("00Gem26")
DestroyItem("00Halb01")
DestroyItem("00Halb02")
DestroyItem("00Sper01")
DestroyItem("00Sper95")
DestroyItem("00Flal01")
DestroyItem("00Flal99")
DestroyItem("00Mace01")
DestroyItem("00Mace02")
DestroyItem("00Mstr01")
DestroyItem("00Mstr02")
DestroyItem("30IStone")
DestroyItem("00Misc18")
SetGlobal("40MendingSpell", "GLOBAL", 4)
